*   An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 is recommended for admission into the program.

Program name: Master of Science in Nursing, Area of Emphasis: Nursing Administration
Requirements: Completed admissions application. A Bachelor of Science in Nursing degree (BSN) from a program accredited by a national nursing accrediting body recognized by Post University. The nursing program must be equivalent to the BSN program at Post University. Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. All foreign transcripts must be evaluated by a NACES approved evaluating agency such as WES or ECE. A cumulative undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for full acceptance. A cumulative GPA between 2.67-2.99 may be considered for provisional acceptance. Proof of an active and unencumbered license as a Registered Nurse (RN) in the state in which the student will be completing his or her clinical practicum. Criminal background check and drug screen through a Post University approved vendor will be required upon admission. The Nursing Department at Post University does not require standardized graduate entrance exams such as the GRE or MAT. Therefore, there are no minimum score requirements for admissions.

Program name: Master of Science in Nursing, Area of Emphasis: Nursing Science, Education, and Practice
Requirements: To apply for our online MSN program, you must have: A Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) degree from an accredited institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education; Undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Applicants with a GPA between 2.5 and 2.99 may be eligible for conditional acceptance; Active, unencumbered license as a Registered Nurse in the state where you plan to complete your clinical experience; Official transcripts from all undergraduate institutions attended; A completed application; A personal statement; A resume; Three letters of recommendation; You must have completed a statistics course at the undergraduate or graduate level with a grade of C or better.

Program name: Master of Science in Nursing, Area of Emphasis: Pediatric Nursing
Requirements:
Application for admission
An earned Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) from a program accredited by the Accreditation Commission for Education in Nursing (ACEN) or the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (CCNE).
A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Applicants with a GPA less than 3.0 may be considered for conditional admission.
Official transcripts from all colleges and universities previously attended.
A current, unencumbered license to practice as a Registered Nurse (RN) in the state where the student intends to complete their practicum hours.
A current resume.
A two-page personal statement of professional goals.
Two letters of recommendation.
Successful completion of a college-level course in statistics with a grade of “C” or better.
Proof of Immunizations (required before practicum).
Background Check, Fingerprinting, and Drug Screening (required before practicum).

Program name: Graduate Certificate in Data Analytics
Requirements: To be admitted to our graduate school, applicants must have earned a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution, or the international equivalent. Graduate School Application Requirements: A completed Post University Graduate Admissions Application; An official transcript from an accredited institution that shows you’ve earned a bachelor’s degree with a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA; An application fee of $50 (may be waived); A current résumé; A personal statement; Official transcripts from all post-secondary schools attended.

Program name: Graduate Certificate in Data Science
Requirements:
To apply to Post University’s graduate certificate programs, you must hold a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution. To apply, you will need to complete the following steps:

Complete a graduate application.
Submit the application fee.
Provide official transcripts from all colleges and universities you previously attended, including an official transcript that shows you earned a bachelor’s degree.
Submit a current résumé.
Complete a 250-500 word personal statement that explains your interest in the graduate certificate program and your professional goals.

Program name: Graduate Certificate in Family Nurse Practitioner
Requirements: To apply for the Family Nurse Practitioner Certificate program, you will need to provide the following: Complete application; Official master’s degree-granting transcript from an accredited college or university with a 3.0 cumulative GPA; Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended; Verification of a current, unrestricted RN license in the state where the student intends to complete the clinical practicum; Personal statement; Resume; Verification of completion of a separate, stand-alone, 3-credit course in Advanced Pathophysiology, Advanced Pharmacology, and Advanced Physical Assessment with a grade of B or better from an accredited college or university within the last five years.

Program name: Graduate Certificate in Finance
Requirements: To apply to one of our master’s degree or graduate certificate programs, you must have: a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution with a minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 (A GPA between 2.5 and 2.99 will be considered for provisional acceptance), official transcripts from all colleges and universities you’ve attended, a completed graduate application and a $50 application fee. In addition, certificate applicants must submit an updated resume that demonstrates at least 3 years of experience in a management or administrative position. Applicants who do not have a resume that demonstrates this level of experience may seek an exception by completing a 500-word essay that details how the certificate will advance his/her professional goals.

Program name: Graduate Certificate in Forensic Accounting
Requirements:
To apply for admission to Post University’s Graduate Certificate program, you will need to submit:

A completed graduate admissions application
A bachelor’s degree with a GPA of 3.0
Official transcripts from all colleges and universities you previously attended
A current résumé
Two letters of recommendation (professional or academic)
A 500-word personal statement describing your professional goals
A TOEFL score, if you are not a native English speaker

Program name: Graduate Certificate in Geographical Information Systems
